pullRequest.body: This should make the metric even more deterministic, which is its primary purpose

nodes.body: !bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/0e3cf73a-d336-4dcb-a6c7-140ef6b76dc5) for commit ec3b108dbd7c61142b0e7ef0f5274fc8fed92ac6.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/0af457d3-a806-4f12-98cc-916b03b84cb3/to/0e3cf73a-d336-4dcb-a6c7-140ef6b76dc5) against commit 38c82baa73b0570f380fbe8bcea9674fef0e6854.

@digama0 You might be interested in this given our recent discussion on Zulip. Locally I saw stddev fall to ~1/10 from this. I think this is the best compromise between determinism and wall-time approximation we can get with a metric for files (and we don't want to add another metric to all 4000 files). Impact seems to be between -0.1% and -30% instructions depending on the file complexity, i.e. smaller files spend more instructions in the kernel relatively speaking.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/6fe7454c-6243-4005-abcf-b56175b9c7eb) for commit 9ece728c2d37c4eb29e68e734794a311ec9f77b2.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/0af457d3-a806-4f12-98cc-916b03b84cb3/to/6fe7454c-6243-4005-abcf-b56175b9c7eb) against commit 38c82baa73b0570f380fbe8bcea9674fef0e6854:
```diff
  Benchmark      Metric                 Change
  ============================================
+ build          .olean serialization   -11.3%
+ build          import                 -12.7%
+ build          initialization         -14.3%
+ open Mathlib   instructions            -6.6%
+ open Mathlib   task-clock              -6.6%
+ open Mathlib   wall-clock             -18.0%
```

Results look good to me: we usually have ~10 or more files with more than 0.5% change, now it's 2: http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/e7b27246-a3e6-496a-b552-ff4b45c7236e/9ece728c2d37c4eb29e68e734794a311ec9f77b2. It would probably make sense to use instructions:u everywhere then.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/05f44b66-033e-4aac-962c-4ddb2e1cd336) for commit 0b7f9a0e95df0131546ab2b19905dbc236211021.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/4968afa7-ffb9-4d8d-9fc3-8b4b3177b818/to/05f44b66-033e-4aac-962c-4ddb2e1cd336) against commit e352bb79f198b8bf40d2e471d40fd81198ded2bc:
```diff
  Benchmark      Metric         Change
  =================================================
+ open Mathlib   instructions   -28.6% (-12603.0 Ïƒ)
```

Let's try this out. 

bors delegate+

:v: Kha can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Measure userspace instructions everywhere
